intro: Symplocos cundinamarcensis, commonly known as the Cundinamarca symplocos, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of Colombia, particularly in the Cundinamarca Department. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
